snippet.title: Gap stores to close in Australia after Oroton pulls pin
snippet.content:
American fashion retailer Gap will shut its doors in Australia within the next six months, its local franchisee has announced. Oroton Group said on Friday it would discontinue its relationship with Gap and expected to close its six Gap stores by the end of January next year.
Up Next
ASX winners and losers - a snapshot
00:43
More BusinessDay Videos
Previous slide Next slide
Oroton earnings report
Clothing and accessories retailer Oroton withholds its dividend as profit halves.
The troubled Australian company said closing the Gap stores would allow it to focus on its core Oroton handbag business and limit future financial losses. However, it was too early to put a figure on what impact it would have, it said.
Oroton said in May it expected Gap's earnings for last financial year to be . Gap employs about 50 full-time and 150 casual staff members. Oroton said it would try to redeploy as many workers as possible but expected some redundancies.
"The board and I thank the entire Gap Australia and Gap Inc team for their dedication and substantial efforts to develop the Gap business in Australia over recent years," Oroton chief executive Ross Lane said. "OrotonGroup also acknowledges the support and co-operation that it has received from Gap Inc in amending existing arrangements."Photo: AP There are four Gap stores in NSW - in the Macquarie Centre in North Ryde and in Westfield shopping centres in Miranda, Parramatta and in Sydney's CBD - and two in Victoria, at the Melbourne Central and Chadstone shopping centres. Oroton is undergoing a strategic review and is , a recapitalisation or refinancing its debt facilities. More to come
